Relationships.Reason: Leonardo spent many of the best years of his life in Milan.
Leonardo founded a School of painting in Milan.
The 'Presumed Portrait of Lucrezia Crivelli' is officially attributed to Leonardo.
Boltraffio perhaps painted the 'Presumed Portrait of Lucrezia Crivelli.'

The influence of Leonardo was strongly felt in Milan, where he spent so many of the best years of his life and founded a School of painting... His strong personal character and the fascination of his genius enthralled his followers, who were satisfied to repeat his types... Among this group of painters may be mentioned Boltraffio
Boltraffio... perhaps painted the 'Presumed Portrait of Lucrezia Crivelli' (Plate VII.), which is officially attributed in the Louvre to the great master himself.
Boltraffio, who perhaps painted the 'Presumed Portrait of Lucrezia Crivelli' (Plate VII.)
